quest.name: The Ananta Maid's Tail
journal: Hancock's apprentice is peering about in earnest.

Spotting an apprentice merchant on the lookout, you inquire as to what he is seeking─only to find out that it is, in fact, you. Sent by Hancock only with the vague instruction to locate you and tell you of his wish to meet, the apprentice asks if you might attend to his master at the harbor. Though at this point you should perhaps know better than to consign yourself to catering to unspecified whims, you nevertheless agree.

Hancock tells you of a visiting delegation from the Ala Mhigan Resistance soon to arrive at the port of Kugane, and requests that you be there to greet them, known to the group as you are. When the ship arrives, who should disembark but two members of the Resistance with whom you are well acquainted indeed: Alpa and J'olhmyn. With an eagerness that suggests that this may have been his plan all along, Hancock leaps at the chance to pass off the obligation to escort the pair around the city to you. With little recourse, you acquiesce to Alpa's request to visit Kugane Castle posthaste.

Though the Sekiseigumi member guarding the castle gate nearly gets off on the wrong footlike appendage with Alpa by making the rather questionable assumption that anyone with a scaly tail is a mermaid, he quickly ameliorates the situation by providing a detailed explanation of the castle's defenses. As it concludes, Hancock reappears to announce that Alpa and J'olhmyn's lodgings are now ready, and recommend that they take some time to relax at the hot springs. Just as keen on soothing baths as they are on spiked ramparts, the two women decide to do so immediately.

You find Alpa gazing at the inn, nearly as impressed with its facade as she was with that of Kugane Castle. She has grown increasingly impatient waiting for J'olhmyn, however, and suggests going to have a look around the Bokaisen Hot Springs while you wait for the Miqo'te to reappear.

At the hot springs, J'olhmyn at last joins you in the water, and you enjoy a rare moment of relaxation─until the sinister mercenary Nhaza'a Jaab appears, remarking on Alpa's passing resemblance to the mermaids of legend. Taking advantage of the steamy environs, he snatches her out of the water and makes his escape.

A frustrated J'olhmyn declares that the most expedient means of tracking down Nhaza'a Jaab and retrieving Alpa will be to look for witnesses. Having now seen multiple citizens of Kugane react to Alpa as if she were a mythical creature, you find no reason to disagree with this assessment.

Though the potential witness you consult has only a passing familiarity with Miqo'te, he nevertheless appears to be in possession of the information you seek. He directs you to the Short Pier, where he swears to have seen a man with peculiar characteristics as well as ears of the appropriate sort.
You arrive at the pier to find not Nhaza'a Jaab, but M'zhet Tia. Based on his position, he could likely use help in more ways than one, but waking him seems like a good place to start.

Your cautious prodding having failed to wake M'zhet, J'olhmyn suggests more robust─and violent─measures. After plucking a few Mark XLII grenades from his pockets and handing them to you, she moves off to enjoy the show from a safe distance.

Now most assuredly awake, M'zhet is shocked to find a scantily clad J'olhmyn before his eyes. Fortunately, once he manages to focus long enough to come around to the point of his tale of seafaring and faring ill, he presents you with a concrete clue as to Alpa's whereabouts. It would seem that he witnessed her and Nhaza'a Jaab boarding a small boat and heading out onto the waves, so to sea you must go.
objectives: Speak with Alpa at Kugane Castle.
Speak with Alpa at the Bokairo Inn.
Speak with J'olhmyn at the Short Pier.
Throw a Mark XLII grenade at M'zhet Tia.

dialogue.name: APPRENTICE03161
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Surname! Hancock sent me to look for you─I'm glad to have found you so close by.

dialogue.name: APPRENTICE03161
dialogue.text: He said he needs to meet with you, but wasn't clear on the details. I suppose he'd rather explain it to you in person.

dialogue.name: APPRENTICE03161
dialogue.text: Would you mind taking a moment to speak with him? He's over at the harbor.

dialogue.name: APPRENTICE03161
dialogue.text: Thank you! Just make your way to Pier #2, if you please. I'll let Hancock know he can find you there.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Forename, my friend! Good to see you again.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming to meet me─though I confess that I knew you would. You are such an agreeable sort, always ready to help your friends and close acquaintances...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: There's no need for such facial exertion─my request is a straightforward one.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: As it happens, I've been asked to escort a few members of the Ala Mhigan Resistance on a tour of Kugane. It seems they are interested in seeing the fortifications that have allowed Hingashi to survive as an isolationist nation for so long.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I've never met them, and it occurred to me that the presence of someone such as yourself, who has an established rapport with the Resistance, might smoothen our introduction. What say you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Right you are, my bosom companion!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: If I just have to stand there, fine.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Good to hear! Particularly as they'll be here any moment.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: By my estimation, they should be disembarking just about now.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Aha, and right I am.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Esteemed members of the Resistance, welcome to Kugane! Allow me to introduce myself. I am Hancock of the East Aldenard Trading Company, and I will be your guide to this fair city.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: I appreciate your coming to meet usss! I'm Alpa, captain of the Velodyna Gatekeepers.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: And I'm J'olhmyn, Alpa's second-in-command. Pleasure to meet you.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Is that you, Forename? Fancy meeting you here, of all places!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: What a pleasant sssurprise! Are you here to show us around?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Now that is an excellent proposal, Miss Alpa! I'm certain the two of you would feel more at ease seeing the city with someone you know. Don't you agree, Forename?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: In that case, I shall leave the role of guide to you. Meanwhile, I can secure accommodations for our guests.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I get the feeling that you didn't have much choice there... Sorry about all this.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: If it's alright, I'd like to visit the castle first. I'm eager to see its fortifications!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: If you would be so kind as to wait at the pier, I shall join you anon.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: It'sss beautiful...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: It does look nice, but I can't imagine it's much use as a fortress. Too decorative.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: What unusual attire! I can see you are not native to Kugane. May I ask where you hail from?

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: By the kami, that tail is real? Are you a mermaid!?

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Don't be absssurd! I'm no mermaid, I'm an Ananta.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: There are many like Alpa in Ala Mhigo, our homeland. There's no need to be alarmed.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Ah, so you are of a Western race, then. Pardon me─I jumped to conclusions. It can be somewhat dull guarding the gate here─particularly as only an utter fool would try to break in─so I sometimes let my imagination get the best of me.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: It's alright─no offense taken. But if you have a moment, would you mind telling us more about this castle? I'm curious as to how a single guard at the gate is sufficient to keep it sssecure.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Of course. I'm no expert, but I will gladly teach you what I know. Consider it an apology for my rudeness.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: The central keep that towers above us is of a complex and strategic make, incorporating myriad defensive elements.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: As you can see, the most prominent part of the facade features regular openings from which to unleash a veritable hail of arrows or musket rounds. We call these sama, and they make it nigh on impossible for an enemy to approach from the front.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Similarly, those unlucky souls who attempt to scale the walls are like to be met by tumbling boulders or boiling oil released by those manning the many brattices.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Should one somehow manage to infiltrate the castle proper, he will find it a trial to get out again, for the pathways inside are like a maze by design.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: To think sssomething could be so elegant in both form and function! I'm impressed.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: All that said, the castle has been taken before.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Not too long ago, an unscrupulous sort named Kageyama and his underlings managed to sneak in during one of the bugyo's galas, taking advantage of the stream of people entering the castle.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Which mainly goes to show that all of the clever defenses in the world mean nothing if you fail to check who's coming through the front door.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: That said, I don't believe in relying on fortifications overmuch. Get complacent enough and your enemy will walk right in through the front door. Which is why I'm here, incidentally.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: A most inssstructive tale. Thank you!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I had a feeling that I would find you here.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Your accommodations are ready. Since your journey was a long one, I recommend that you stop for a soak in Kugane's famed hot springs before you continue your sightseeing. I can personally vouch for their efficacy in soothing body and soul.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: In that case, how could we refuse?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: That's settled, then! Just make your way to the Bokairo Inn at your leisure. I must return to the Ruby Bazaar, but I've ensured that you will find everything in order.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: My first Hingan hot springs! I hope you'll join us, Forename.

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: She really is like a faerie tale mermaid come to life. The other bathers are in for a surprise...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Impressive! Visually speaking, anyhow.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I leave our guests in your capable hands!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: This inn is spectacular─I've never seen anything like it. And to think that we can just go right in!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: I wish I could show it to Gales...though it might be safer not to.

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Anyway, J'olhmyn went inside to change ages ago, but it doesn't seem like she's coming out any time soon. She does wear an awful lot of armor...

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Why don't we have a look around while we wait for her? There's no harm in that, right?

dialogue.name: HOKUSHIN
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, it's possible that our tales of mermaids were based on sightings of Ananta to begin with.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I leave our guests in your capable hands!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Seeing it has only made me want to get in more...

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: J'olhmyn won't mind if we meet her in the water, right? Right. So let's go─unless you need some time to change into your bathing suit as well? I hear it's customary to wear one, at least in Kugane.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Enter the hot springs in your current garb?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: Thisss feels wonderful! I'm so glad we came to Hingashi.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: It is nice to properly relax once in a while.

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERA03161
dialogue.text: Look there! Is that a mermaid?

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERB03161
dialogue.text: That tail, those scales... Unmistakably a mermaid! I can't believe they've been real this whole time! And right here in our hot springs!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: This is ridiculousss─I'm clearly no fish.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Haha! I suppose people who've never seen an Ananta just don't know what else to make of you.

dialogue.name: CUSTOMERA03161
dialogue.text: Well, I never! Mermaids in the bath!

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Miqo'te-)Did someone say “mermaid”?

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: Did someone say “mermaid”?

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: (-Menacing Miqo'te-)What's this, a Seeker? And one with most...unfortunate features, at that.

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: What's this, a Seeker? And one with most...unfortunate features, at that.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Not as unfortunate as your manners. And I would say something about the creepy mask, but I reckon the face beneath is even worse.

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: Now, am I meant to believe that you don't recognize me, Nhaza'a Jaab? You certainly have the look of an Eorzean, but perhaps my legacy has not yet reached whatever drab little corner of the realm you call home.

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: Hmm, yes, on closer inspection I can see that our Far Eastern friends simply mistook serpent for fish. Not that it matters for my purposes, of course. I can hardly believe that I came upon a convincing substitute so soon...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: That's enough of your leering!

dialogue.name: ALPA
dialogue.text: What are you doing!? Get your hands off of me!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Alpa!?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I swear, you masked maniac, if you've done something to Alpa...

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: It's funny... I thought only to make a bit of coin on my travels through this foreign land, but it seems the beastmen and I are simply meant to be.

dialogue.name: NHAZAAJAAB
dialogue.text: In any case, I'll be helping myself to this one. I welcome a challenge, so feel free to hunt me down...if you can. Hah...hah...bwahahahahahahahahaha!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Hells take that Nhaza'a! And what is he, anyway? I can't believe he managed to snatch Alpa right out from under us!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: No, now's not the time. Our first priority needs to be tracking them down. Thankfully, if the locals' reactions so far are anything to go by, I'm sure they stood out. We can start by asking around.

dialogue.name: TOWNSPEOPLE03161
dialogue.text: A...“Miqo'te,” ma'am? I'm afraid I don't quite know what you mean.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Oh, right. I'm talking about someone with ears like mine. Male. A bit odd in the...facial area. He might've been behaving strangely, too. Does that ring a bell?

dialogue.name: TOWNSPEOPLE03161
dialogue.text: Ah, so you folks are called “Miqo'te”! I've seen quite a few of you around Kugane of late. And there was a man fitting that description over by the Short Pier, when I passed by not too long ago.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I guess we're headed seaside then. Thanks for your help!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Did you see a Miqo'te pass through? It's important!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: This is...not what I was expecting, in a variety of ways.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Now that we've found him, I suppose we ought to make sure that he doesn't die. We're going to need him to wake up first, though. I don't know─maybe poke him in the face?

dialogue.name: TOWNSPEOPLE03161
dialogue.text: “Miqo'te.” What a charming name for a people! And they do have the nicest ears.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Miqo'te before you is slumbering vigorously. Though he seems to be in a bad way, he is unmistakably alive and will probably survive without your intervention.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: ...And you're sure he's not already dead?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: In that case, we'll have to get creative. And I have just the thing! Well, he does, anyhow.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Just as I thought─he never leaves home without his Mark XLII grenades. I assume he took the time to remove some of the powder after his...prior experiences, so they should be safe enough. Lob one in his general direction, would you?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I'll stand back a bit. Just in case.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Feel free to do whatever it takes to wake him up. Nothing like a robust jab to the eyes to get the blood pumping, that's what I always say.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: AaaaaaAAARGH!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: I believe I at last truly grasp the meaning of the phrase “a rude awakening.” Which is to say, ow.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Make no mistake, I am delighted to see you, Forename─but I would appreciate it if you would put a little more thought into your method of greeting next time. I was having such a nice dream, too...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I can't say I expected quite that large of an explosion. I thought for sure you'd remember to take the powder out this time.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: But why are you here, anyway?

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Gah! J'olhmyn!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Your attire is rather less...present than usual!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Ah. Now that you mention it, I did forget to put my uniform back on, didn't I?

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: More importantly, though, we have a serious problem on our hands!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: M'zhet? Are you listening to me?

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm listening! And definitely making a normal amount of eye contact!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: But never mind that─Alpa's been kidnapped! I saw her being carried away by a man with the most peculiar mask...

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: You saw him?

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Uh...yes? Yes. As it happens, I stowed away on your ship to get here. And that went perfectly smoothly, thank you very much, until you two disembarked and ran off, leaving me without a clue where to go.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: As I was wandering about aimlessly, as one does, I saw the masked man with Alpa in tow. I called out to them, and he hit me! Without so much as a warning!

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Before I fully lost consciousness, however, I witnessed something vital─he and Alpa boarding a small boat.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: I'm positive they were headed out to sea.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Then there's not a moment to waste! We'll board a ship at once. You too, M'zhet.

dialogue.name: MZHETTIA
dialogue.text: Of course─I would never abandon Alpa in her time of need! In fact, I shall begin scanning the seas in search of any passing vessel that can carry us away right this moment. Feel free to, say, put on a coat while I do!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: I encourage you to pelt him with those bombs as hard as you can. We don't have time to be gentle─Alpa's trail is getting colder by the moment.

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: Ouch!

dialogue.name: JOLHMYN
dialogue.text: It looks like M'zhet did remember to take some powder out─not that you knew that when you decided to test it on me! You could have blasted my suit clean off!
